answers.answer: Why on earth are you not on medicine??  Have you started thyroid meds??Yes a TSH of 73.99 is dangerous in my opinion. Your thyroid regulates just about your entire body including respiratory and heart function.You poor thing.....I am sure you do feel just aweful and like a walking zombie!

Hello ,You shall ask for an appointment  with an endocrinologist ,and before that ask for these blood tests :FT4 ,FT3 ,thyroglobulinAb ,TPOab .It will be great if you meet an endo after having these tests done .all the best ,
I had a level of 94.0 on my TSH 6 years ago. My doctor said I could have easily been in a coma!!!! Get help!
Yes i was at 144 with my TSH , i was lucky we started meds when we did..I hope you are on meds for this, you will become very ill...Dawn

Mine was at 55.51 when I was dx'd and my heart rate had slowed way down (30 bpm during sleep), my cholesterol went through the roof, etc..... yes, I believe this can be dangerous and you need to be on med, but you also need to have FT3 and FT4 levels checked.If you go to an endo, make sure you are getting one who specializes in thyroid issues and not one who only specializes in diabetes.

question: my TSH level now is 73.99 is that dangerous, I feel really bad now my legs are hurting really bad when I walk, I'm always tired, I get irriated quickly. I don't understand this what could be going on, I try to work but it's getting hard, can i apply for disability.
title: thyroid
